Attached is the memo to the President from you and Melanne, to which I
will attach the materials outlined in the memo: Is it okay? I'll bring it
to Staff Sec as soon as you sign off.   Thanks.==================== ATTACHMENT    1 ==

                                              April 9, 1997
                                                                          Automated Records Management SvstOIt
                                                                                  Hex-Dump Convt.'Sion   .


    MEMORANDUM FOR THE PRESIDENT

    FROM:                 Melanne Verveer
                          Elena Kagan

    RE:                   White House Conference on Early Childhood Development and Learning


    As you know, on April 17th, you and the First Lady will host the White House Conference on
    Early Childhood Development and Learning: What New Research on the Brain Tells Us About
    Our Youngest Children. Materials on the Conference will be forwarded to you over the course
    of the next week. Attached for your early review are three documents which help to frame the
    issues of early brain developement and its implications for parents, caregivers and policy-makers.

    ·      Starting Points, Carnegie's seminal 1994 study on the first few years of life;

    ·      Rethinking the Brain, the Family and Work Institute 1997 report which will be released
           around the time of the White House Conference; and

    ·      Newsweek's Special Edition Your Child, which will be on the stands in the next few
           weeks for several weeks (Hillary has the original in the Residence; a copy is attached).
